name: Trimbakeshwar

deity.mythology_link: Associated with the Godavari source tradition and Gautama Rishi

location.sacred_geography: Near Brahmagiri hill and Kushavarta, linked with the Godavari origin tradition

significance.rank: Eighth Jyotirlinga in the Nashik-Trimbak sacred zone
significance.philosophy: Trimbakeshwar is associated with Shiva worship and ritual traditions tied to the Godavari and ancestral rites.
significance.scriptural_reference: Shiva Purana and regional Godavari Mahatmya traditions

stats.daily_visitors: Varies by season and special ritual days
stats.annual_visitors: Large annual pilgrimage footfall, especially during Kumbh cycle
stats.kumbh_visitors: Very high footfall during the 12-year Nashik-Trimbak Kumbh cycle
stats.unique_feature: Widely known for ritual traditions such as Narayan Nagbali and Tripindi Shraddha

description: Trimbakeshwar is one of the twelve Jyotirlingas and a major Shaiva center in Maharashtra. Nashik district administration notes that the present temple structure was built in the 18th century under Peshwa Balaji Bajirao on an older sacred site.
secret_hook: Trimbakeshwar's ritual traditions and links to the Godavari make it one of western India's most important pilgrimage centers.
